39428084.review: As successor to the outstanding changeup minesweeper that is Hexcells, Plus does a good job of keeping what made the original good and cranking up the difficulty with small additions. There are 2 new mechanics, the first being a mine that has a number showing how many other mines are within 2 hexes in any direction, adding significant depth and difficulty; the other being the addition of question marks in place of numbers on the occasional block. The first is intriguing and allows for more avenues and calculations to figure out where a block could be, the latter being a frustration as you can easily figure out where an empty space is, just to be hit with a roadblock in the form of a big ? taunting you. Overall, if you liked Hexcells you'll like Plus and spend much more time with it and it's heightened difficulty.

38840761.review:
Hexcells Plus is the second game in the wonderful Hexcells series of puzzle games and presents us with a new set of challenges for us to solve. Does it improve upon the excellent first entry? This is what I think of Hexcells Plus. 

It's quite difficult to say. There are slightly more puzzles in this one with 36 and as always the simple concept of the game still remains fun. Well designed levels as you would expect from this series along with relaxing ambient music make for an enjoyable first half of the game. Until you are hit square on by a truck called difficulty curve and suddenly it becomes very challenging. I'm not certain I liked that too much. 

The goal is the same as last time around; clear the board by colouring in hexes or deleting them in what is an immensely satisfying activity. It also introduces a new rule in the form of a hex with a number indicating how many hexes in a surrounding area there is by clicking on it. That's good. I thoroughly enjoyed the first few sets but when the difficulty ramped up beyond what I could feasibly work out, in crept my frustration. Part of the reason I don't play many puzzle games is because they can be challenging at times, sometimes unreasonably so, and I feel like I'm wasting time as I agonize over solving them. 

And this time around it seemed too hard for much of the later part of the game, at least for me. As I pointed out in my last review, I'm not quite at that level of being able to work out any puzzle in these games and once again I resorted to guesswork a lot more than the last game. I wasn't looking forward to this one as I remembered it was hard and it was the same this time around. My least favourite of the Hexcells games but a very good puzzle game.

To finish off then, I didn't enjoy this as much as the first game. That is not the same as it being a bad game. Far from it. The challenging later levels are probably a delight for those clever enough to appreciate them but for me they were too frustrating. This remains a must buy for puzzle fans and is much more of a challenge than the first, which was more relaxing. If more of the same but a harder challenge sounds like your thing, buy this. It's rather good.

38758947.review:
Very fun and very challenging addition to the Hexcells series.  It's a lot harder and a lot less forgiving than the previous two.

I can't tell you how many times I've been nearly finished with a puzzle for the completion achievement to perfect every level, and one simple misclick.  One accidental bump of my mouse ends up screwing the entire puzzle I've spent 30 minutes on.

IMHO that's a little *too* unforgiving.

運要素ナシでぜったいにクリアできるマインスイーパ改ってかんじのHexcells、の続編です。
頭の体操にぴったり。

■tips
・ランチャ画面でマウスクリックの設定を入れ替えると右クリックでマーク、左クリックで解放になるのでオススメ。
・枠外にある数字はクリックすると列がハイライトされてべんり。不要になった数字は右クリックで薄くできる。
・青数字はクリックすると範囲が見える。不要になったら右クリックで薄くできる。

前作と比較すると難易度が上がっています。
新しい要素としては周囲6マスのさらに外側までカウントする青数字が出てきます。
青数字は地雷の場所を探すというより、地雷のない場所を見極めていく使い方をすることが多くなります。

安全な場所を見極めて撃ち抜け！

マップ固定なので適当にクリックして地雷を特定していけば絶対にクリアできるんですが、偶然に頼らず遊んだ方が楽しいと思います。

誤クリック対策か1ミスまではパーフェクトクリアと見なされるようです。
2ミス以上したマップはアイコンが光らなくなります。パーフェクト実績を取るときは確認してみて下さい。

オススメ。

Hexcells Plus builds on the pleasant, Minesweeper-y goodness of Hexcells. Once again, it's a good Sunday morning game, though two things are worth calling out. For one, it's considerably longer than Hexcells, clocking in at around 9 hours compared to its predecessor's 2. And for another, it leans more heavily on a slightly more fiddly clue type (whammies within a localized area) that may have you poking your screen a bit to count out hexes. The game is still good, but the UI isn't quite as clear as it needs to be for how frequently that comes up.

Do note that the levels are specifically designed rather than randomly generated. If you're looking at this, it's probably worth picking up the entire Logic Puzzle Pack. Each game has its own charms, and Hexcells Infinite brings an infinite puzzle generator to go with the pre-crafted ones.

34853458.review:
Hexcells Plus is a great puzzle game, and a great continuation of the first Hexcells game. Much like the first game, the base mechanic is that tiles are either marked blue or give a number representing the number of blue tiles adjacent to them, somewhat similar to minesweeper. But the game takes that base mechanic, adds a few other basic mechanics (number of blue in a column, marking that some need to be consequtive, having some '?' tiles), and builds it into a wonderfully satisfying and relaxing puzzle game. The music is ambient, and actions taken in game generate tones that go with the music as well. All puzzles can be solved without guessing and have a single solution, so when playing, I find it most enjoyable to take my time and only take action when I know it is correct.

The puzzles largely pick up where the first game left off. While there is some introduction to the mechanics, it is done in levels that serve to introduce the mechanics while also providing some challenge if you played through the first game. The levels (36 in total) grow in difficulty more quickly than in the first, but even the last few levels, although they can take some time to carefully comb through, remain enjoyable and approachable. The new mechanic, blue cells with numbers that give the number of tiles within 2 blocks, is used well, and makes for neat levels that are just as good, if not better than the levels in the first game. It took me about 7 hours to play through the game originally, and a majority of that time is on the last few, larger, levels (it took me around 40 minutes to do level 35 when I played through a second time, though I probably could have been faster if I'd wanted).

All achievements but 'Perfectionist' will be unlocked simply by playing through the levels. 'Perfectionist' requires that you beat all levels with no more than 1 mistake each, so if you play through each level the first time with that in mind, it too will be unlocked after a single playthrough. If any levels are completed with more than 1 mistake, you can simply redo them again, so all in all the achievements for this game are straightforward.

The Hexcells series is wonderful, and I highly suggest you pick up the complete pack of all 3 if you enjoy peaceful deductive puzzle games.

Excelente trilogía con idénticas bases y aspecto en cada juego. No es imprescindible haber jugado los interiores, en cada uno se dan las instrucciones necesarias. Soluciones muy elegantes en los 3 repasando todas las pistas cuando parece que ya no puedes avanzar (con la excepción de algunos niveles del "Plus", como comentaré).

El primero, Hexcells, tiene una [b]duración de menos de dos horas[/b]. Una única solución posible en cada nivel. Muy recomendable empezar por este y ver si es lo tuyo o no, porque siempre podrás devolverlo si no te convence.

La continuación Hexcells Plus introduce nuevas reglas, tiene unos cuantos niveles de bastante mayor dificultad, pero el problema de que algunos tienen múltiples soluciones y no hay pistas suficientes para saber cuál es la correcta, tienes que jugártela a suertes. En mi opinión el desarrollador colocó un producto mal terminado para aprovechar el tirón del anterior.

El último de la serie, Hexcells Infinite es el que debes comprar después de haber probado el primero. Mismo aspecto y mecánica, pero algo más demandante y con un generador de niveles para que no se te acabe y la opción de dejar un tablero parcialmente resuelto para continuar en otro momento.

33598630.review:
"Hexcells Plus" is the second game in the "Hexcells" lineup.  It's very much like the original "Hexcells," except the puzzle difficulty ramps up immediately (since we already have experience with them from the first game) and the developer added one more puzzle element:  a number in a blue hex indicates the total number of "hits" in the surrounding TWO rings of hexes.  That's actually one of my minor complaints with the game:  I kept making silly mistakes because I confused the "number in the blue hex" with the "number in the black hex" (the number of "hits" in the surrounding ONE ring of hexes).

I do have to watch my phraseology in these reviews.  In my review of "Hexcells," I said:  "...still, it would be nice if it were longer."  Well, the developer listened.  The original game took me 4.1 hours to complete its 30 puzzles with all Achievements.  This game took me 21.1 hours to complete its 36 puzzles with all Achievements.  So, it's absolutely worth the price.  The trouble is that most of these puzzles are MUCH harder (and longer) than those in the first game.  And, since progress within puzzles can't be saved (only the completed puzzle is saved), that leads to puzzle fatigue and even more silly mistakes (clicking the wrong mouse button, black vs blue hex numbers, flat out missing hexes, etc.).  Still, I can't really complain.  This is a really entertaining, worthwhile game.  Recommended.

This doesn't feel as good at the first one... Still a great core design, but hampered a bit in certain puzzles.

Maybe it's just me, but some levels (6-5 in particular -- fuck that level) don't seem to be easily solved by logical inference alone? Could just be that I'm not chaining together enough sequential steps in my head though. I'm a bit thick sometimes. YMMV.

Anyway, this one seems to rely a bit too much on those annoying unknown (?) markers to obfuscate or artificially extend the difficulty a bit more than I would like in certain areas. It's especially irritating when some of the marked blue hint cells are redundant or unhelpful, since the inference can sometimes be easily made from a nearby set.

I do recommend it, but it's not as cleanly designed as the first one. I kinda just wanted more of that, and this felt a bit arbitrary at points. It's still the same great core game, with a few added wrinkles. Same ambient soundtrack, for the most part, with very similar visuals.

I liked it enough to buy the next one in the series (on discount), in spite of the fact that a few puzzles in this one really irked me. Take that for what you will. I still think it's really good, just could've used a bit more polish. And I'm half-convinced that 6-5 can't be solved by logical inference alone (i.e. no guesswork), but I'm honestly not certain about that.

A significant jump in difficulty from the first game, which I finished quickly, Hexcells Plus has taken over a day of my time and yet I've still never finished it. Admittedly, that's partly because I sometimes restarted the game to see if that would help, but even so.

It adds new mechanics to the ones introduced in the previous game, and has a much steeper difficulty curve. It's a good, solid puzzle game, even if I've occasionally had to use guesswork to solve puzzles. Hey, maybe I'm just bad at them.

33264897.review:
Minesweeper meets Sudoku part II

Building off the original Hexcells keeps all of the good stuff while ramping up the challenge and the content. The overall design is the same, but there are 36 puzzles this go around and they added a new class of hints (blue hexes with numbers inside them) requiring a lot more awareness than the previous game. Furthermore, the difficulty seems to escalate more quickly than the original. Highlighting the new blue hexagons creates a faded appearance on the screen (which isn't always easy to see which hexes are in range) and multiple highlights can whiteout the area. 

There are no saves and limited menu options as well as limited replayability but I put in 14 hours into this game, but I did get stuck in a few places and replayed levels whenever I made a mistake. If you liked the original, you will love this sequel.

32432770.review:
不太明白3部中plus和infinite哪部才是第二作，总之通了1代后就打通了这个。
还是一代的老问题，操作和扫雷相反，经常搞错，加上蛋疼的完美主义者成就，每关至多犯错一次，不然就得重开。有些关卡篇幅很大，手抖了就得拍照复盘，反复多次甚是扫兴。
本篇难度比一代高了许多，但不是高在规则难度上，而是高在完美主义者成就容错率和问号六边形上。篇幅大，加之亮瞎眼的配色 ，所以很容易看花眼，提示范围的白色虚影看不太清。我视力不好背一半锅，颜色设计的也确实有问题把！至于问号六边形，强行隐藏信息撑大篇幅，一个大关就是被问号分开的几个小关而已，不知道该怎么评价。
感觉游戏的机制本身是有漏洞的，因为固定关卡的游戏只能靠限制错误操作来防止玩家随意“趟雷”，最终的完美主义者成就就是强迫症成就，毫无成就感可言。

31708848.review:
[h1]数独+扫雷[/h1]
前作Hexcells的增强版Hexcells Plus。
整体难度可能是前作的4倍（注1）。

基本操作同前作。但本作新增：
蓝底白字雷：2层（2圈）范围内隐藏的地雷总数（不含本格）。

就一条新设计，
却让一个单层雷区的清除往往需要配合周围雷区的条件进行2重甚至3重计算，双层雷区更甚，使得推理逻辑的计算量大幅增加。

[strike]更不提作者在白色背景上用白色范围标记附近雷区的奇葩设计极其伤眼。多少次为了这种白+白的设计看不清雷区范围导致点错1格从而整盘血崩。（全成就要求的完美收集使得平均每关最多只能错仅仅的1次。）
继承前作的左右键相反的操作也不提供键位自定义，简直了。[/strike]

虽然关卡地图变得庞大，却还保持每关皆有两种以上撕开突破口的过关方式，不会让玩家破罐破摔乱点一气，这点很让人佩服。

[b]玩的时候很痛苦，通关的时候很爽，大概说的就是这种游戏。[/b]


注1：粗略计算难度：前作3小时全成就，本作12.4小时全成就。12.4/3≈4.13，约等于4倍难度。[spoiler] 毁眼程度大概也是4倍。 [/spoiler]

30770479.review:
First Steam game I've been compelled to review. 

The craft and focus in this puzzle game is unmatched in my experience so far, except by a Tetris/Dr. Mario, perhaps. The way the rules of the game continue to build on each other is absorbing. The payoff when you can piece it all together, with the serenely soothing sounds and animation of receiving your perfect score -- it's satisifying in its quiet meditative reward.

Of course this is the sequel to the original Hexcells, which is a sort of requirement, as this game continues the logic branches from the previous. The first set of puzzles in Hexcells Plus basically assume you've played the first.That game is definitely worth playing, but this is certainly the stronger of the two because of how in-depth a challenge it presents.

If you like puzzles games, this is a must. If you don't, then at least play the original Hexcells on a friend's account if possible to give it a shot. Brilliant game.

30293821.review:
The question is obviously not if Hexcells is a good idea for a game in general in this one, if you want to buy this game you most likely already played the original Hexcells and want to know if this one is worth it.
And I'd have to somewhat disagree.

First of all the puzzles are WAY harder than they were in the original Hexcells. In the original Hexcells they were a bit difficult but not stupidly difficult and I managed to get through the game without a single mistake.
Now this however is an entirely different story. This just becomes frustratingly stupid at some point and I couldn't manage to get through a single level without having at least one mistake somewhere.

The puzzles sometimes have up to 100+ hexes that you have to solve (which is just bullsh*t at this point) and just searching for a way to continue some of those puzzles is like searching for a needle in a haystack. 
They didn't really bring any new elements to the table such as having to actually think around a few corners before you make a decision. Rather this game seems to just be "Hexcells: Now stupidly increased in size to confuse you!"
It's not a good concept to just make the levels stupidly large without having to actually add in new ideas to make you think around a few more corners. 
Don't get me wrong, the puzzle design is still great, but I'd just wish they'd make a lot more compact puzzles but focus a lot harder on the thinking aspect. Most of my frustration with this game came from the fact I overlooked a blue tile bordering a black one, thus giving me a mistake. This is something that never happened in the original version just because the puzzles were a lot more compact and easier to overlook.

Overall if you really can't get enough of this game I'd recommend it if it's on sale. But if you look for something new or new interesting puzzle concepts and thinking around a few corners to blow your mind and find that piece of the puzzle that lets you continue it, this unfortunately isn't the game for you.

清新的六边形扫雷第二作
比第一作更大，更持久……更难……

游戏依旧对人品要求极低，仅需推理就可以完成关卡，如果出现了需要蒙才能点击的方块，说明你又漏条件了，重新检查一下吧
地图依旧是固定的，依旧预留3个存档，可以玩3次【依旧并无卵用】
依旧可以一路瞎点然后重来背板满足0失误
获得全奖励允许出现错误一次，也就是说允许你手误一次

单纯的靠提升地图大小来增添游戏难度……

游戏增加了一种新的游戏标记
在雷【蓝色方块】的上面增加了一个数字标记，表示这个雷的2格以内的范围内有多少个其他的雷

[h1] 操作说明总结 [/h1]
左键标记雷右键点开方块

雷上面的数字标记是可以点击的：
左键点击之后会提示你这个数字标记所标记的范围，减轻观察的压力，方便推理
右键点击后雷上的数字标记隐藏，表示这个范围已经推理完毕，数字标记已经无用了

不在雷上面的数字标记分以下3种：
x：表示有x个地雷
-x-：表示有x个地雷，并且这些地雷不是全连在一起的
{x}：表示有x个地雷，并且这些地雷全都连在一起

当数字标记在方块内时，表示周围的地雷数等于数字标记；
当数字标记在地图外时，表示这一列的地雷数等于数字标记：
左键点击这个数字画一条辅助线，减轻观察压力，方便推理
右键点击这个数字可以把这个数字标记隐藏，表示这一列已经推理完毕，数字标记已经无用了

It's an expansion of the first game and has new puzzles; if you haven't beaten the first game, this is much harder (and some of the puzzles, especially in the last levels, were extremely frustrating; in some final parts, I really had to see walkthrough on the youtube).

29950839.review:
Hexcells is a minesweeper with 0% luck and 100% guess, hexagons instead of squares and (far) better graphics. The rules are quickly and efficiently explained, leaving you to focus on solving the puzzles.

As the second installment of the Hexcells serie, the game remains much the same except for the level of difficulty of the new puzzles; the learning curves is steeper and it was not uncommon to take one hour to solve one of the latest puzzles. The only downside is that you can't save and exit in the middle of a puzzle, either you finish it or you'll have to start from the beginning the next time.

This game is worth buying, especially as part of the Hexcells bundle.

29845486.review:
A fantastic followup to Hexcells, itself a game that I really enjoyed.  This game was only slightly larger in scope in that there were 6 worlds as opposed to Hexcells' 5.  There also was not a lot of addition to the ruleset established by Hexcells.  However, neither of these are particularly negative points, given the polish of the original game.  The additions to the ruleset are well thought out and add another dimension to the game.

The set of puzzles in this game are particularly fiendish, but all can be solved without guessing, although sometimes it might be tricky to spot which part of the puzzle you have unlocked.  I played to get the Perfectionist achievement, which meant plenty of restarts of tricky puzzles.  I thoroughly enjoyed it though, even with the frustrations of being most of the way through a tough map and then making the wrong call!

I would wholeheartedly recommend this game, and look forward to getting stuck into the next game!

本着一丝完美主义心态的我终于玩完了这个游戏，成就收集完成！
HEXCELLS的续作，增加了少许的难度。
除了6-5那一关难以追求到完美以外，其他的难度都还可以，适合休闲时候锻炼一下脑子。
这系列的游戏告诉我们这么几点：
·需要综合考虑多方面的因素。
   —有些东西隐藏在远方，你需要注意。
·需要提高即使记忆能力。
   —有时候运气点点点也是蛮重要的（当你推断不出来的时候），用这一次的死亡给下一次做铺垫。
·不要搞混左右键。
   —受从小玩到大的windows系统自带的扫雷的影响，一开始经常搞反左右键，造成了不少mistake，现在玩多了还好，不过精神恍惚的时候就！
·用耐心去玩。
    —讲真这个游戏的BGM还是蛮抒情的，特别是你点出来一个又一个的时候，简直超级爽快！消磨烦躁，静下心来，进行美妙的谜题。

“升级版的扫雷”，比较有趣，要是关卡更多一些就好了，不够玩啊！！！

这款游戏最吸引我的就是它严密的逻辑性。而我也在一步步推理的过程中感受到逻辑的魅力和游戏的快乐。

这款游戏我觉得比扫雷更能带给我快乐。1、它比扫雷要简单些，因为只有6个部分需要考虑。2、相比于扫雷，它的逻辑更严密，每一个雷都有据可循，都可以通过严密的逻辑推理得出。3、相比扫雷这款游戏有更多的有趣的提示方式，我所见的有数独游戏中，通过外围的数字进行提示，以及一些如｛2｝、-2-这样有趣的设置。4、不得不提它的配色及界面的设置也是很棒的。比起扫雷美观，或许这也是我对它青睐有加的原因。5、游戏的bgm较为轻柔，与游戏的结合十分好。

我个人是十分推崇这款游戏的，为了获得完美通关，我也不惜推翻大量时间玩成的游戏，重新开始。其实事实上是不愿承认自己的推理出错了：）

不得不说，这样一款游戏还是很适合喜欢逻辑推理的小伙伴的，不过游戏的难度还可以期待一下，至少Helxcells带给我的快乐不及Plus。它的难度太低了

29478269.review:
So I played all the Hexcells games and this is the second of the series.

Let me tell you something right away, if you expect this game to be exactly like the first Hexcell, IT IS NOT.
This game is harder and challenging by introducing new elements.
One of them is the "?" spaces where it removes the number around the blank spaces which forces you to look at other details for information.

ALL PUZZLES IN THIS GAME CAN BE COMPLETED WITHOUT GUESSING AND JUST PURE LOGIC.
Every other review that states you need to guess to progress are terribly wrong.
You need to check other information such as how many blue space remind for example.

IF YOU HAVE A HARD TIME, I LARGELY RECOMMEND CHECKING THE [u]100% NO MISTAKE GUIDE[/u] AS IT EXPLAINS HOW TO SOLVE EVERY PUZZLE LOGICALLY! 
I use it to check on cases where I am just stuck, hard, and see if there was something I missed and I missed a lot of stuff. (I also suck at counting...)

Anyway, I would recommend this game if you want a challenge but do not get it if you wanted the same game as the previous version. 
The puzzle's pacing is long because of it.

PS. Hexcells Infinite added a save feature which I wish it added in this one...

29229924.review:
Hexcells erinnert anfangs an Minesweeper, wird jedoch schnell abwechslungsreicher. Ziel des Spiels ist es alle Felder aufzudecken. Diese können entweder Blau sein oder Grau sein und dann Informationen über die Anzahl benachbarter blauer Felder enthalten. Durch diese Information werden dann benachbarte Felder systematisch nach dem Ausschlussprinzip aufgedeckt. Zusätzlich wird durch Zahlen außerhalb der Felder angezeigt, wie viele blaue Felder sich in einer Linie befinden. In diesem, zweiten Teil der Serie, gibt es zusätzlich Informationen über die angrenzenden Felder auch in blauen Feldern. Jedoch beschränkt sich die angezeigte Zahl nicht auf die 6 direkt anliegenden Felder sondern auf 18 umliegende Felder, also quasi 2 Kreise um das Feld herum. Dadurch wird dieser Teil deutlich komplexer im Vergleich zum Vorgänger.

Falls man mehr als einen Fehler in einem Level macht, bekommt man Punkte abgezogen. Am Ende des Levels erhält man dann eine für das Level festgesetzte Anzahl Punkte. Wenn man nicht alle Punkte freischaltet muss man das Level noch einmal machen und mit nur einem Fehler bestehen. Mit einer gewissen Anzahl Punkten kann man dann immer 6 neue Level freischalten bis insgesamt alle 30 Level freigeschaltet sind.

Da Hexcells ein abwechslungsreiches und auch auf gewisse Weise schönes Rätselspiel ist, dass sich mit etwas Ruhe und Geduld gut bewältigen lässt, kann ich es sehr empfehlen. Der Preis ist recht günstig und die Errungenschaften sind in diesem, zweiten Teil der Serie, mit etwas Engagement gut zu erreichen.

Ich empfehle, dass Hexcells Complete Pack zu kaufen, da bei Hexcells Infinite ein Levelgenerator integriert ist, der bis zu 1 Millionen verschiedene Level generieren kann und somit die Mischung aus einfachen, schweren, symmetrischen, chaotischen und in Mustern angeordneten Leveln durch eine riesige Anzahl zufälliger Level abgerundet und dadurch die Wiederspielbarkeit massiv erhöht wird. Der Preisvorteil des Complete-Packs gegenüber dem Einzelkauf der Spiele ist ein weiterer Grund für das Pack. Besonders im SALE ist das Complete Pack durch seinen geringen Preis ein tolles Geschenk für Fans von Logik-Puzzles.

29173380.review:
Quick Note - I played this entirely offline, so it didn't track my play-time at all.  I'd guess a good few hours myself.  Either way, it was time well spent.  

This is more of the same kind of fun from the first game, but it kicks up the difficulty a good deal.  In the first game, I defeated most of the early level bundles in a very short period of time.  However, in this game even the earlier levels were taking me longer because of their increased complexity.  It adds a couple of new gameplay elements, which makes the player have to figure out new methods to logically deduce what tiles can be clicked on or eliminated.  I appreciated the increase in difficulty myself, though it did get pretty brutal in the last few levels.  I'd say it's worth playing, especially if you appreciated the new kind of puzzle game from the first title.  Looking forward to trying the last game of the trilogy, see what it has to offer to close off the series.

29030141.review:
This review is mainly a response to the reviews claiming that unlike Hexcells, Hexcells Plus requires guessing to complete the  levels. This is false. The game is certainly more difficult than its predecessor, but no level actually requires guessing. Some places just requires combining information from two or even three different sources, but those sources are plain to see (though sometimes you have to complete other parts of the level to uncover that information). It's not always easy, but with a firm grasp of the mechanics involved you can always figure out 100% which hexes are what. One of the most fun aspects of the game is finding that logic rather than guessing. 

If you liked the first game and would not mind a more difficult version, I see no reason not to recommend Hexcells Plus to you.

29005322.review:
整个系列包括三部作品。Hexcells，Hecells Plus，Hexcells Infinite。因为系统基本一样，所以放到一起来讲。
游戏时间：（全成就通关）
Hexcells 2小时
Hexcells Plus 9小时
Hexcells Infinite 主线通关大概13小时，60关随机无尽大概5小时

缺点：
界面过分简洁。想把音乐关掉还要回主菜单。前两代没有关卡进度储存，也没有暂停菜单。三代才有了一个聊胜于无的暂停菜单和自动进度储存。
按键跟扫雷相反。改键的话，一二代要在进游戏之前修改，三代要在主菜单修改。不是很方便，不过只用改一次，也可以接受。
完全没有自动完成的概念。举个极端的例子，所有雷已经被标出的情况下，那些不是雷的方块也需要一个个点开，有点麻烦。
对于追求完美通关的人来说，失误惩罚略严重。大图快完成的时候点错一次简直想死，建议掏出手机拍照重新点一次。状态不好经常点错的话（推理数错，点的时候脑抽搞不清楚左右键等等）建议睡一觉第二天再玩，不要硬来。
总的来说都是一些细节上的小缺陷，不算什么。
优点：
最重要的一条，每一关都一定有可以只通过推理得到的唯一解（而且这个推理不会复杂到整个图试填的级别，基本可以只靠眼睛看）。这是这个游戏的正确打开方式。有为数不多的几个英文差评说这个游戏需要猜，我只能说请给智商充值。另外，这个有唯一解的特性有时可以帮你跳过一些推理步骤（例如ABC一横排三个点，关于BC唯一的信息是BC之中有且只有一个雷，那么A一定不是雷，因为这样你才可能解出BC是什么），但其实不是必要的，建议不要用。
没用了的信息除了不是雷的点上的数字（黑数字）之外都是可以隐去的。当然如果可以把黑数字也隐去就更优雅了，不过现在这样已经很方便。
辅助线和辅助区域的设计非常贴心。在有了进度保存的第三作，如果你觉得辅助线不小心开了太多不想一个个关，或者是在某一关卡住了之后怀疑自己隐去了不该隐的数字，可以退出关卡重进，所有辅助线和隐去的数字都会恢复（当然点开的雷和数字不会，不然就不叫进度保存了）。

上面都是系统，下面说关卡。只有优点。
关卡设计都非常精巧，不是随便挑一些比较难的infinite的关然后就当作主线了。（后面的关）信息量被压缩到了最小，如果观察不同人同一关的流程，基本上会是一样的。不过这种唯一性因为条件设计得足够隐蔽，并不会无聊。
足够难。这个游戏的玩法本身可以做成扫雷那样的运气推理结合的游戏也可以做成数独那样纯粹的推理游戏，它选择了后者。有的推理很难，可能要看几分钟甚至更多才能看出来，但是也正是这种推理在完成之后给人最大的满足感。这是一个纯粹推理的游戏应该做到的。
节奏感非常好。数独这类的填空推理，都会有一种滚雪球效应。一开始填最难，后面空格少了之后就水到渠成了。Hexcell通过引入？方块，可以将你的成果截住。经常出现的情况是苦思几分钟，势如破竹扫雷一般搞定半片地图，又卡住，再苦思几分钟然后扫雷。这种张弛之间的节奏感是很难得的。

一个纯粹的解谜游戏，循序渐进、难而有趣的关卡，张弛有度的推理快感，优雅的设计（唯一解、隐去数字、画面简洁）。
全包原价34人民币总共108关加上infinite无限生成说实话已经算便宜了，打折之后全包只需10块简直不买是人。
抽象解谜类作品的必玩典范，非常推荐。

26606870.review:
Das Spiel ist, leider!, nicht gut.

Dabei wäre es beinahe so gut. Die Rätsel (wenn richtig designed) waren eindeutig herausfordernder als im 1. Teil (Hexcells), so dass ich mich richtig gut unterhalten fühlte.

Aber wo man, denke ich, im 1 Teil noch alle Rätsel ohne raten lösen konnte, weiss ich hier bei einigen sicher und bei vielen bin ich mir ziemlich sicher, dass man an teils vielen Stellen nur durch raten weiterkommt. Dies ist teils ganz offensichtlich, also gewollt. Raten! in einem Logikrätsel pur! Ich verwende sonst keine Ausrufezeichen in einer Rezension, aber hier...

[i]Falls ich mich dennoch irre, nehme ich die Rezension hier zurück.[/i]

Interessierte kennen sicherlich die Logikrätsel aus diversen Zeitschriften und bei den qualitativ guten muss man einfach nicht raten. Das ist das Wesen eines Logikrätsels.

Demnach ist Hexcells Plus nur ein belangloser Zeitvertreib. Komm ich nicht weiter, dann probier ich einfach mal aus. Schadet ja auch nichts, weil, wenn das Feld nicht blau ist, ist es eben schwarz und ich komme weiter. Das entwertet aber die Leistung, ein Rätsel gelöst zu haben. So kann ich immer ein "Rätsel" lösen und habe kein Erfolgserlebnis.

Ein Trost ist, dass vielleicht die Hälfte der Rätsel tatsächlich ohne raten lösbar sind. Und diese haben teilweise wirklichen Tiefgang und beanspruchen die grauen Zellen. Dies Rätsel haben mir sehr gut gefallen, besonders wenn die Hinweise wirklich gerade so ausreichten, um alles lösen zu können. So sollten alle Rätsel sein.

Pro & Contra:

+ Teils exzellente, fordernde Rätsel

- Viele Rätsel, die teils nur durch raten lösbar sind

Wertung: 04/10

Dass einige Rätsel stellenweise nur durch raten lösbar sind, entwertet das ansonsten von der Idee her sehr gute Spiel, das eigentlich ein Logikrätsel ist. Übrig bleiben ebenfalls einige rein logisch lösbare Rätsel. Wenn einem das genügt, dann kann man es kaufen.

26545472.review:
This review is written for Hexcells, Hexcells Plus, and Hexcells Infinite
[h1]Hexagonal Puzzler[/h1]
[b]Reviewed after completing all achievements[/b]

[h1]Gameplay[/h1]
Hexcells plays like an average 2d puzzle games, you click your mouse to solve the puzzles not hard.  Untill you get to the later puzzles that is.  This game has one of the most ingenious puzzle systems I've played to date.  It isn't so complex that you're left scratching your head at what the rules that these puzzles follow are, but it isn't so simple that it becomes boring after you've completied a few of them.

I will say that while trying to %100 this game I looked up a few of the solutions [i]after[/i] completing them once.  This is because this game has a 'perfect' rating, in which there must be no missclicks on a puzzle to actually complete it for the achievements.  And while I did mess up sometimes when solving these puzzles, most of the time these missclicks were due to me acidentally resting my fingers on my buttons while trying to solve a hard section, or right clicking when I should have left clicked that time damn it!

[h1]Graphics[/h1]

This game has a great look to it, but playing it at night will strain your eyes due to the brightness of it.

[h1]Verdict[/h1]

This is a great game and well worth your time if you're looking for a puzzle game to play.  Though the achievement in Hexcells Infinite where you must complete some of the random puzzles just takes far too long.

[h1] 8/10 [/h1]

Le jeu se posant en suite direct de Hexcells, les afficionados seront heureux d'apprendre qu'il rentre dans le vif du sujet beaucoup plus rapidement que son ancêtre, et que la majeure partie des puzzles proposés sont relativement corsés, et très peu de niveaux sont des tutoriaux (pour illustrer les nouvelles règles, et c'est tout).

很有趣的六角形踩地雷

用踩地雷的概念來說明，滑鼠左鍵標示為地雷，右鍵為安全空地

空地上的數字是周圍有多少地雷，

隨著關卡經過，會逐漸多出一些更細緻的規則，

例如說大誇號代表周圍的地雷必須相連，減號代表周圍的地雷不能全部連在一起，要有一個以上的間隔

或者是地圖外的數字代表該條直線上的地雷有幾個等等。

唯一的缺點大概就是關卡少了一點。

26092306.review:
Enjoyed this game a lot! Gives a minesweeper kind of feel, which adds in more puzzle enhancements as you progress through the levels. Starts off very basic so that you get a feel for the game, and then you look up and all you want to do is perfect all the levels. So the games goes, there are a few blocks with numbers on the board and you have to puzzle out whether the block is another number or a blue block. The block has 6 sides (obviously) and the number says how many blue block are touching it. As the game progresses, it adds {} around a number to say the blue blocks are sequential, or -- around a number to say they are split. It then goes father to say that there are so may in this line by putting the number on the outside of that row or column. The easy feature which helps a lot for bigger puzzles is that you can click on the outside number and it draws a line through that row or column to see which ones.

All in all lots of fun and challenging at the same time. Gets more challenging as the game goes on. Has new additions from both the infitine version as well as the origional Hexcells.

This second version of Hexcells was more frustrating than the first. Whereas in the first game, I never felt that my mistakes were unmerited, it seemed that this game forces you to make leaps of faith. Either that, or the game doesn't teach you how to solve more complex configurations in the same way the first game does. In both cases, I felt the quality level/puzzle design was inferior to the first game.

25995445.review:
[COPIATO E INCOLLATO DELLA RECENSIONE DI HEXCELLS]
Il vostro PC è un tostapane?
Avete speso tante di quelle ore su Campo Minato, Sudoku e simili al punto tale che avreste potuto laurearvi, trovare un lavoro e sposarvi?
Se la risposta è Sì, allora questo è il gioco che fa per voi.

Hexcells è un puzzle game molto interessante ispirato a Campo Minato con qualche richiamo a Sudoku. In ogni livello dovrete sbloccare tutti gli esagoni, e per farlo il gioco vi fornisce indizi come per esempio quante celle blu si trovano in una colonna o sono adiacenti a un esagono nero, ecc.
Man mano che si procede la complessità dei livelli aumenta sempre più, ma comunque, il gioco non è un gioco basato sulla fortuna: niente è lasciato al caso. Gli indizi che vi forniscono sono strutturati in maniera tale che potete finirlo senza fare un errore (sfida che gli amanti hardcore dei puzzle apprezzeranno).
Graficamente si presenta minimalista e piacevole, in grado di girare anche su PC estremamente datati.

L'unico difetto è l'assenza di un generatore di livelli e la possibilità di poter salvare la partita anche durante un livello. Per la seconda spesso ovviavo a ciò facendo uno screenshot del livello.

Hexcells Plus aggiunge sostanzialmente altri livelli, più complessi presentando gli stessi difetti del primo.
Hexcells Infinite, invece, oltre ad aggiungere nuovi livelli risolve anche i difetti legati ai primi due giochi, ovvero la generazione casuale di livelli e la possibilità di salvare la partita.
Sono giochi che consiglierei l'acquisto in bundle (Hexcells Complete Pack) e magari a prezzo scontato.

25981748.review:
Now, compared to the first Hexcells game, this is something worth buying. A much steeper learning curve and harder levels mean that 100%-ing Hexcells Plus is no longer something you can do in one, two-hour-long seating. If Hexcells was the tutorial or the demo, Hexcells Plus is an actual game. As of writing this review, I still have 5 puzzles to do perfectly, and I've already played almost 3 times as long as it took me to 100% the first game.

As for what the game is - it's the same as the previous one: a brilliant, addictive fusion of Minesweeper and Picross. This time around, the interactive soundtrack is more rigid - sounds play according to the rythm of the ambient background music as opposed to the rythm of your own clicks.

Overall, a good puzzle game that's worth the price, especially if you grab the Hexcells Complete Bundle during a sale.

25979386.review:
The second part in the Hexcells series expands and improves on the rather lackluster first part. A new mechanic is introduced and in general the levels are much more challenging and demanding. As a seasoned player of logic puzzels this game took me around 10 hours to complete and brought me much more enjoyment than the way too easy first part of the series. Sadly there still is little replayability (this is only fixed in the third installment). My only real gripe is that far too often this game derives its difficulty from a bigger quantity rather than a better quality. Most of the later levels are huge and the challenge becomes less figuring out logic puzzles than it is spotting the one tile bottleneck that lets you continue. Still each level typically has an area that is very interesting and makes you feel really satisfied after figuring it out. The absolute high point of this game were the three small levels providing tough nuts to crack with little distraction.

Design and UI are the same as the first installment. The soundscape created is still interesting but I had to mute the game an hour in because it started to become grinding. During some of the larger levels a save functionality would have been nice to have. I've never encountered a bug, error or crash.

If you like challenging logic puzzles this might be worth full price to you. I can wholeheartedly recommend picking this up as part of the trilogy compilation or at a discounted price.

Confieso que la colección de Hexcells me tiene totalmente enganchado. Los debí comprar en un bundle porque los encontré de casualidad haciendo 'limpieza' de mi biblioteca. Me puse a jugar al primero (Hexcells) y me gustó, aunque consideraba que era uno de esos juegos de puzzle hecho más para móviles que para escritorio. 

Lo malo es que no me lo sacaba de la cabeza.

Y ahí sigo, a los pocos, completando celdas hexagonales. Normalmente cuando vengo del trabajo con estrés (y esta temporada he tenido ración triple) suelo poner algún juego de repartir sopapos, por ejemplo Batman, y me desahogo haciendo kárate virtual (el de verdad es peligroso, ya me costó un ligamento cruzado). Pero ahora me dedico a averiguar que celdas tienen color y cuales no escuchando esa musiquita New Age relajante. Y oye: funciona. No me digáis que me estoy haciendo viejo, ¡eso ya lo sé! De hecho alguna vez me he sorprendido queriendo jugar al Witcher y habiendo perdido un rato largo con éste mientras me decía: 'una más y lo dejo'. 

En fin... que lo recomiendo. Y lo recomiendo sin ambages: como un juego de verdad, bueno, no como un juego de esos 'que está bien porque viene en un bundle'. 

Si te gustan los puzzles: te molará. Si necesitas un juego relajante: te molará. Si quieres dejar un poco tu vena psicópata virtual: te ayudará a parecer una persona cabal. Pero cuidado porque engancha. Por suerte tengo el Hexcells Infinite, que he leído que es procedural, para cuando termine éste. Porque si no ya me veía como un yonky de los polígonos... hexágonales.

Hexcells plus is the devil spawn of the simple logic puzzle game that stole our hearts, [url=http://store.steampowered.com/app/265890]Hexcells[/url].

While at its core, Hexcells is a fun, loving simple logic puzzler, Plus is what happens when demons spawn on the streets and start dragging people to hell. For how the game feels, you can read [url=http://steamcommunity.com/id/XenoLair/recommended/265890] my review of Hexcells[/url]. Plus is the same game but with much harder levels, which you shouldn't be playing unless you've tasted the sweet fruits of the first one. Plus is hard to the point of getting stuck in a level and just not seeing any way to progress through it any further. It had me guessing on some levels which really should not be done in a logic puzzle. I'm not sure whether I just didn't see the clues or if the puzzles were designed that way. 

Think of it like eating chili peppers. The mild ones have a rich taste, not too hot and spicy enough to open a pallet of flavors. Plus is what happens when you eat that 700.000 scoville habanero pepper and just cannot taste anything for a week after that. That's kind of how I feel about Hexcells plus. It's still fun, I still kept coming back to it after failing many times. I'd only recommend it if you tried the first game and were left wanting more. 11 hours to 100%.

25774297.review:
If you've played Hexcells - and you should! - then you already know what this game is about: Minesweeper-like logic puzzles where you process out hexes that are occupied and those that are empty.  But if you've played Hexcells you are still only slightly ahead of the curve, as these puzzles are much more difficult and require much more attention and deduction than the predecessor.  The first Hexcells took me 3 hours to master all the levels (without a guide, natch) while Hexcells Plus has already taken more than that from me and I've only FINISHED 1/3 of the puzzles so far!  Granted that may say more about me than the game, but I think the general truth of the proposition holds.  A unique introduction is the ? hex, which can lead to a puzzle board dead end that can only be solved by looking off the board rather than on it; no numbered hexes to assist you, and only the beauty of logical deduction can remedy it.  

As with the first Hexcells, you can always guess (ala Minesweeper's early game "cheat" method) but that frankly defeats the purpose of playing a logic puzzle game.  You can also refer to the Steam guides to solve overly difficult puzzles, but I would recommend doing neither; this game is immensely rewarding when you defeat a level using only your reasoning faculties and that is how it should be played.  Highly recommended (even though I haven't finished it yet!), and the best $3 game on Steam I've yet found.

Tengo que reconocer que antes de ponerme a jugar a este título ya había leído opiniones muy favorables sobre él, sin embargo por el tipo de juego que es no me hice con él hasta que se incluyó en un humble (además era de los títulos ocultos, así que mayor sorpresa fue). Ahora tengo que señalar que no habría pasado nada porque lo hubiese comprado independientemente porque se lo merece.

Bajo su aspecto minimalista y aparentemente simple, se esconde un puzzle, que en algunos casos pueden llegar a ser complejos (aunque siempre se puede solucionar aplicando la lógica) Bajo unas reglas que se van incrementando conforme avanzas, deberas descubrir el patrón de fichas azules que se esconde en el tablero. Cuando empeceis, es imposible que no os recuerde al buscaminas, pero le añaden cierta complejidad y lógica haciendo que nunca se dependa del azar.

Indicar por último, por si lo veis en la tienda, que hay varios títulos y el orden sería Hexcells -> Hexcells Plus -> Hexcells Infinity El primero es muy simple y por lo tanto os lo pasareis enseguida, pero no esta de más jugarlo para introduciros en la mécanica.

Recomendado a bajo precio, que cada poco tiempo esta de oferta.

25567133.review:
[Play Time] : 9시간 (스팀 도전과제 100% 진행 기준)

[게임장르] : 퍼즐게임

[게임소개]
: 육각형(헥셀)의 네모네모로직과 지뢰찾기를 맛깔나게 버무린 퓨전 형태의 퍼즐게임

[한줄 평]
: Hexcells 퍼즐의 시작은 Plus 부터~


[게임평가]
: 네모네모로직과 지뢰찾기를 맛깔나게 잘 버무린 퍼즐게임(Hexcells Plus) 입니다. Hexcells 의 2번째 작품으로써 Hexcells(1편)보다 퍼즐 갯수 증가, 새로운 Rule 추가, 난이도가 상승하여 많은 변화가 이루어진 작품으로 사실상 Demo 같이 느껴지는 Hexcells(1편) 보다 본 작품(PLUS)가 진정한 Hexcells의 시작지점이 되는 작품이라고 볼 수 있습니다.

 첫 작품의 Hexcells 보다 난이도가 대폭 상승하였기 때문에 첫 작품(Hexcells)을 1시간 이내에 클리어하고 너무 쉬운 난이도에 많은 실망을 가지신 분들일지라도 본 작품(Plus)를 실제 플레이 하신다면 상당한 난이도를 접할 수 있을것이며 첫 작품에서 느꼇던 편견(실망?)이 산산히 부셔지는 느낌을 받으실 거라 장담합니다.

 필자는 Hexcells 퍼즐을 Infinite(3편) -> Hexcells(1편) -> PLUS(2편) 순으로 플레이 및 도전과제를 달성하면서 각 작품들을 비교하자면 다음과 같습니다.

(1). 난이도
 Infinite(3편) > PLUS(2편) > Hexcells(1편) 

(2). 플레이 타임 (도전과제 100% 달성기준)
 Infinite(3편) > PLUS(2편) > Hexcells(1편)

(3). 각 작품의 차이점

 i. Hexcells (1편)
   - 짧은 플레이 타임 (2시간 이내)
   - 쉬운 난이도
   - 3, 2편에 비해 퍼즐의 갯수가 적음

 ii. Hexcells PLUS (2편)
   - 새로운 Rule 추가 (물음표와 파란픽셀의 갯수를 나타내는 픽셀 등장)
   - 다양한 난이도의 퍼즐
   - 1편에 비해 증가된 퍼즐 갯수

  iii. Infinite (3편)
   - 게임 Rule은 2편과 동일
   - 2편에 비해 조금 더 어려운 난이도가 등장
   - 중간 저장기능 (중간에 퍼즐을 이어서 할 수 있음)
   - 생성기 포함 (퍼즐을 랜덤하게 생성해 주는 기능)

 해당 작품들의 차이점을 비교한 결과 Hexcells(1편)과 PLUS(2편)을 비교하자면 Rule이 추가되고 난이도가 대폭 상승하여 큰 변화를 가지게 되었지만 PLUS(2편)과 Infinite(3편)을 비교하자면 중간 자동저장과 생성기 외에는 크게 변화된 점이 없기에 진정한 Hexcells 퍼즐을 즐기기 위해서는 PLUS(2편) 부터 즐길것은 추천드립니다.

 또한 Hexcells 작품은 한글화가 되어 있지는 않지만 퍼즐이 진행시 Rule이 추가되면 튜토리얼격인 연습 퍼즐이 존재 하기 때문에 게임을 학습하고 진행하는데 큰 어려움이 없이 즐겁게 즐길 수 있으며, 연습 퍼즐을 플레이 해도 이해가 잘 안되었던 필자(?)와 같은 분들을 위해 이전 Infinite(3편) 평가에 남긴 Rule 설명을 첨부 하도록 하겠으니 참고하시어 즐거운 플레이가 되시길 바라겠습니다.

<아래 설명은 필자의 Hexcells Infinite 게임 평가란을 참조함 >
-------------------------------------------------------------
1. Campaign : 총 6단계의 레벨로 분류되며 도전과제 획들을 위해서는 1개 이상의 Miss가 발생되어서는 안된다.
- 1~2단계 : 게임의 Rule 을 설명하는 튜토리얼 개념
- 3단계 : 지뢰찾기 방식의 플레이
- 4단계 : 네모네모로직 방식의 Rule 이 추가
- 1~4 단계는 헥셀과 상하좌우의 숫자 힌트를 통해 논리적인 방식으로 클리어 가능 (1 Miss 클리어 기준)
- 5단계 : 힌트없음(?)이 등장하며 논리적으로만 풀기는 어려우며 수학적인 통계학이 필요함
- 6단계 : 힌트없음(?)들로 인해 맵에서의 구간이 나뉘는 경향이 있어 어느정도의 운이 따라야만 함.


2. 게임 Rule
- 검은색 헥셀 내 숫자 : 해당 헥셀 주위(범위:1)에 있는 파란색 헥셀 갯수를 나타낸다
- 파란색 헥셀 내 숫자 : 해당 헥셀 주위(범위:2)에 있는 파란색 헥셀 갯수를 나타낸다
- {숫자} : 헥셀이 붙어 있는 것을 나타낸다 (ex. {2} : 파란색 헥셀이 2개 나란히 위치해 있음}
- '-숫자-' : 헥셀이 붙어 있지 않고 떨어져 있음을 나타낸다. 
- 숫자만 표기되어 있다면 붙어 있을 수도 있고 떨어져 있을 수 있으나 {}는 무조건 붙어 있고 -는 1개 이상은 헥셀이 무조건 떨어져 있다는 것을 나타낸다.
- '?' : 힌트없음으로 해당 헥셀 주위에 몇 개의 파란색 헥셀이 존재하는지 모른다는 뜻이다.
- 상하좌우에 있는 숫자 : 해당 라인(Line)에 존재하는 파란색 헥셀 갯수를 나타낸다.


3. 게임 기능
- 파란색 헥셀 숫자 On/Off 기능 : 파란색 숫자를 클릭하면 엷은 검은색으로 표기된다 (우측 마우스)
- 파란색 헥셀 범위 On/Off 기능 : 파란색 헥셀을 클릭하면 해당 헥셀 범위가 표시된다 (좌측 마우스)
- 상하좌우 숫자 On/Off 기능 : 상하좌우 숫자를 클릭하면 엷은 검은색으로 표기된다 (우측 마우스)
- 상하좌우 라인 On/Off 기능 : 해당 라인의 엷은 하얀색 줄이 표시되며 해당 라인의 가시성이 향상된다 (좌측 마우스)

25487108.review:
I feel bad not recommending this game, but it really cranked the difficulty past the point of being fun for me.

Many levels have "bottlenecks" where there are only one or two moves you can deduce as being risk-free, and these sections feel deliberately, artificially hard. The signal-to-noise ratio is such that you feel like you're looking for a needle in a haystack. 

I feel no shame in stating that I had to consult a guide (which had so many pictures that it frequently crashed the Steam browser) just to know which column or blue hex I should focus on to deduce my next move - there's no option to save your progress and resume later, and real-world obligations meant that being stuck for tens of minutes on a single move would mean the difference between finishing the level or starting over from the beginning the next day.

Even then, it took me 11 hours(!) to complete Hexcells Plus, versus just 2 hours for Hexcells. And that says it all, really. I had fun, overall, with Hexcells Plus, but it felt too tedious too often for me to recommend it in good conscience.

25322360.review:
Una juego de puzzles que mezcla las mecánicas del Picross y el Buscaminas para obtener algo nuevo, original, y que se puede volver complejo de narices.

La principal vía para resolver los puzzles es la lógica ("Esta pieza no puede marcarse porque esta otra lo impide, así que la tacho"), y aunque la primera mitad del juego es más o menos sencilla y se pasa del tirón mientras nos van enseñando mecánicas nuevas, los dos últimos mundos son mucho más complejos y requerirán bastante tiempo si queremos hacerlos sin cometer errores (aunque, la verdad, son mucho más permisivos de lo que me gustaría).

Hay ocasiones en que podría pensarse "Este puzzle no me está dando toda la información que necesito para resolverlo", pero la verdad que al final siempre encuentras algo que te habías olvidado de comprobar, o hay que ir un paso más allá y pensar en hipótesis con más factores para poder tachar o marcar una pieza y seguir adelante.

Decir que este juego tiene 3 versiones (Hexcells, Hexcells Plus y Hexcells Infinite). Son esencialmente el mismo juego con las mismas reglas. La básica es demasiado fácil y corta, así que mejor elegir entre Plus o Infinite. De ambas, me quedaría con Plus porque Infinite es un poco nivel masoquismo en los últimos puzzles.

Still, recommended for fans of good puzzle games! Every level is still solvable without guessing and just by pure logic, and that is wonderful.

25158229.review:
Hexcells is, on the most basic level, a more sophisticated version of Minesweeper. You are given a layout of golden hex tiles, possibly with one or more of them already highlighted or flipped. Flipped tiles have numbers on them, and also labels indicating whether or not adjacent tiles which should be highlighted are continuous or non-continuous (or no designator at all). There are also row and column labels which allow you to see how many tiles need to be highlighted in any given row or column.

Each puzzle mixes these up in a unique way to push you to solve it.

Thinking about this game as a more sophisticated version of minesweeper is, I think, fairly ideal, because that is more or less what it is, and the function it serves. It is something to throw away a bit of time on, not sit down and play continuously.

It is about as fun as Minesweeper is, and I’d basically consider it filling that role in your game library.

That said, Hexcells Plus, as a sequel to the original game, is designed for people who have beaten it; if you haven't beaten the first game, this is much harder (and some of the puzzles, especially the very last couple, were extremely frustrating; I still don't know how you are supposed to solve the very final puzzle correctly).

My advice? Pass. It isn’t a bad puzzle game, but it isn’t anything remarkable either. If you did get it as part of a bundle or something, it isn’t a terrible thing to install and just screw around with when you’d mess around with solitaire or minesweeper or whatever, but I wouldn’t go out of my way to buy this.

24902145.review:
[h1]"А можно просто объяснять всем, кто этого еще не понял, что "Тетрис", пасьянсы, шахматные и карточные программы, "Bejeweled", "Lines", "Jawbreaker" и прочие — не компьютерные игры. На компьютере? Да, и что с того? Так вот и в нашем случае: "[b]Hexcells Plus[/b]" на компьютере "только ездит", по-настоящему он его не использует" © Андрей Ленский, журнал ЛКИ[/h1]

[b]"Hexcells Plus"[/b] - логическая казуальная игра, совмещающая в своих правилах "Сапёра", японские кроссворды, щепотку новизны разработчиков, и дополненная нетривиальными ситуациями, в которой необходимо перевернуть определенным образом гексы на игровом поле.

По аналогии с "Сапёром" есть игровое поле, состоящее из гексов, на котором присутствуют чёрные гексы с цифрами в середине, показывающими дополнительное количество черных гексов в пределах одного радиус-круга. Всё остальное - гексы голубые. Благо в настройках при запуске можно поменять раскладку, а то всё по старинке ищем отсутствие "мин", вместо их присутствия. При прохождении 6 головоломок откроется еще 6, могут добавиться новые условия, например, количество черных гексов на линии и т.д. Задача - решить все головоломки. В каждой головоломке можно сделать одну ошибку. Обучение текстовое на простом английском, да и игра начинается с интуитивно понятных задач. В игре появились ситуации, когда приходится выбирать наугад, ввиду недостатка информации, чего не было в оригинальной "Hexcells".

Графически игра сделана в стиле минимализма.

Музыка же представляет из себя эмбиент, вот только если заранее известно какие гексы где находятся, быстрое переворачивание приведёт к игре, как на клавесине. Озвучки никакой нет.  

Управляется игра мышью.

Недостатки: хоть и присутствует разнообразие графического разрешения, но 1280х1024 нет. Хотелось бы генератора головоломок после прохождения, сохранений, ведь некоторые партии могут занять до получаса! Радиус-два слишком бледен и незаметен. Нетривиальные ситуации.

Для обладателей математического склада ума эта игра развлечёт на работе больше, чем ранее упомянутые "LYNE" и "Faerie Solitaire" и еще сильнее, чем прародительница "Hexcells". Удачная смесь "Сапёра", японских кроссвордов и щепотки новизны от разработчиков, дополненная нетривиальными ситуациями, подарит массу удовольствия. Достойная компьютерная версия некомпьютерной игры. [b]"Hexcells Plus"[/b], рекомендую.

24723886.review:
[h1]THIS GAME SCORES [0 1 | 2 *3*] = ~88% (75%-100%)[/h1]

I recommend that you buy the [url=http://store.steampowered.com/sub/50074/]Hexcells Complete Pack[/url] with all 3 games - that's why this review text is identical for all 3.

It's a [i]great[/i] puzzle game series that strongly reminds of Microsoft Minesweeper, but not only is the grid hexagonal (meaning 3 instead of 2 axes), the games even go well beyond mere neighbor-field estimation.

The levels eventually get very hard, and the procedural mode in "Hexcells Infinite" that exists in addition to the hand-crafted levels all three games have is a bit too chaotic (and hard) for my personal taste - well, it's procedural, its levels are not nicely designed and organized like the other levels.

Anyway, since I wanted [i]more[/i] of the easier puzzles and especially of the feature that numbers at the grid's periphery say something about the grid's content, I made a (very crappy) [url=http://dreamspace-president.com/index_crappyGames.html#StupidLittleMinesweeper]puzzler[/url] in a few hours after finishing the Hexcells games that helps a bit with those needs.

Hey, Matthew Brown, if you ever make a game like this again, I'm very likely to buy it, and I bet there's a bunch of people out there who think alike.

For those who like this kind of puzzle game, I can't recommend the Hexcells games enough.

[b]Hexcells Plus[/b] is essentially more of the same puzzle sets introduced in the original Hexcells earlier in 2014. As such, my earlier review comments '[url=http://steamcommunity.com/id/aussiedroid/recommended/265890][u]here[/u][/url]' still hold true. Where I feel [b]Hexcells Plus[/b] differs is in the difficulty. I found most puzzles relatively easy in the original, but in Plus there were a number that kept me scratching my head. 23998079.review:
Больше, Интереснее, Сложнее!

Продолжение игры Hexcells. Что ещё можно сказать? Если по каким-то причинам вы прошли мимо первой части, исправьте это. Как минимум это поможет в освоении, поскольку продолжение расчитано на опытного игрока и гораздо сложнее с самых первых уровней. 

Приготовьтесь к долгому и тщательному решению каждой головоломки, теперь это не просто семечки, это настоящие грецкие орехи. Кроме этого, в игру доабвляются новые условия. В этой части задача будет постепенно меняться. В начале поиски будут начинаться со свободных клеток, а в итоге придется обнаруживать "мины" вокруг "мин", с подсказками как в японских кроссвордах (которые уже были в первой части). Такой поворот событий приятно обновляет игру.

Всё очень сложно и прекрасно    [spoiler]... но как обычно идилию портит определенность расположения "минного поля", когда после неверного ответа, узнаешь правильный даже не поняв на то причины (а их становится гораздо меньше)[/spoiler] 

[url=http://steamcommunity.com/id/kurukitsune/recommended/265890/] Обзор[/url] первой части Hexcells 


10 сложных гексов из 10 сладеньких медовых сот

A fun and challenging logical puzzle game similar to MineSweeper.
Using the numbers to work out which tiles to mark.

The big difference between Hexcells and Minesweeper is that you never need to guess at any point, there's always a way to work out where to click.
Also, numbers can be shown on the outside of the grid and show a different symbol with the number to tell you how the tiles you need to mark are laid out.

The only issue I have with this is that it's really short and there's no replay value in it.
If you wish to save a bit of money then I suggest only buying HexCells Infinite which contains the same as this but also has a random level generator for.. infinite.. replayability.

23042262.review: Hexcells Plus is second part in the series which brings 36 new puzzles to the table. It is Minesweeper-like game where your goal is to decipher the pattern and mark the blue cells by gradually eliminating empty ones. They contain numbers which show how many blue cells are adjacent. Additional rules are introduced soon such as number of cells in columns, and clusters of cells that must be separated from each other or adjacent to one another. One new mechanic is introduced compared to the first game in series - some blue cells have numbers which indicate how many of them are located in a 2 hex radius which contributes to higher game difficulty. Levels are much bigger and more complex than the first game, and it took me 4x as much time to finish it, about 6 hours.

22852188.review:
I'd give this game a 4/10. The original hexcells was fantastic, one of my favorite puzzle games. This is the same, but... Hexcells is based on the idea of having a clever puzzle game with simple rules. The introduction of the blue tiles that tell you how many other blue tiles are within two hexes, however... It's not a good mechanic. It's not impossible, but it's just not intuitive, especially with the shapes hexes create. You're suddenly dealing with these weird flower shapes where much of the flower is confused by strange colors or parts missing. It's not fun. 

It's confusing, but not in the way a puzzle should be. It feels like bad design and it comes in very early on. I don't find drawing patterns on the screen to find what I'm supposed to be looking for fun. I'd rather be solving the puzzle than trying to figure out *where* the puzzle is. A simple outline to show where the area is, like was done for the slanted lines in previous games, would have gone a long way.

It's not the worst mechanic ever, and I'm sure some people enjoy it, but I personally cannot recommend this game because of it.

六角版踩地雷

順便說一下玩法


相連是只中間沒有建隔黑色方塊，不管兩塊之間離多遠都叫相連

數字表示週圍藍色的數量
-數字-表示週圍至少一個不相連藍色的數量
{數字}表示週圍相連藍色的數量
寫在方塊外面的數字表示直線上藍色的數量
藍色數字方塊，數字表示週圍*兩圈*內藍色的數量

22843310.review:
基本玩法跟扫雷类似的游戏。不过有一些不同点。
它不需要像扫雷一样有时要猜雷，每个格子是否有“雷”可以完全依靠逻辑推理得出。因为它不是随机生成的，而是经过精心设计的谜题。不过这也意味着谜题数量是有限的，不能无限玩下去（第三部除外）。
不过谜题难度循序渐进，逐渐增加新元素，玩的不失乐趣很也有成就感。画面极简风格，符合当下潮流。
需要注意的是鼠标左右键的功能和扫雷不同，左键是“标记”，右键是“翻开”。（不过在设置里可以更改）

Hexcells Plus是系列第二部，难度有所提高，建议先玩比较简单的Hexcells。以后再去尝试第三部Hexcells Infinite。
有点遗憾的是到第三部才支持中途存档和云存档。

+循序渐进的难度
+全成就容易
+简单清新的画面
-谜题有限
-不能中途存档
-没有云存档

————————————————

基本规则并不难，如果看不懂，简单讲一下

黄色格子是没翻开的，黑色格子是空格，蓝色格子是标记的“雷”。
空格里的数字表示周围六个格子里有几个是雷。
带{ }的数字表示周围的雷是连续排列的。
带- -的数字表示周围的雷是不连续排列的。
边缘的数字表示一整列里有几个是雷。（左击数字可以打开辅助线，右击可关闭数字）
同样，带{ }、- -的数字表示这一整列里的雷是连续或者不连续的。
蓝色格子（雷）里的数字表示周围两圈范围（18格）内有几个雷（不算自己）。（左击可打开范围指示，右击可关闭）

以上就是整个系列所有需要用到的规则。

本作的最后一关（FINISH）有几个附加条件：[spoiler]第一个和最后一个字母一共有16个雷；其中一个字母没有雷；元音一共有5个雷。[/spoiler]

右上角的REMAINING表示还剩多少雷没标记（这也是一个重要的参考），MISTAKES表示犯错次数。
犯错不会立即GAME OVER，而是可以继续尝试，所以你瞎猜也可以完成游戏，不过拿到的星星会变少（影响后面关卡解锁以及全成就）。不过只犯错一次也可以拿全星星，所以当实在找不出突破口的时候，可以猜一次。

所有关卡全部通关+全星星就可以拿全成就了。

[spoiler]取巧方法：先不管出错次数，玩到快结束，截个图，然后重新开始谜题，对着刚截的图重玩一遍，可以无脑全星星。（反正谜题是固定的嘛）[/spoiler]

Hexcells Plus is the same exact game as original Hexcells, but it offers 36 different (more challenging) puzzles.  

Hexcells is a minimalistic logic puzzle very similar to classic Minesweeper. You need to find blue cells and numbers show you how many of them are nearby. 
[list]
[*]For one, there is no instadeath. If you make a mistake, you just keep going. 
[*]Most importantly with a little bit (and sometimes with [b]a lot[/b]) of thinking you can figure out where each blue cell is located. Unlike minesweeper where sooner or later you come to a point when you have to close your eyes and guess randomly. 
[/list]
Music is very nice and the game itself is relaxing. 

I recommend buying [b]Hexcells Complete Pack[/b] (Hexcells, Hexcells Infinite, Hexcells Plus) because you will definitely want more.

21131536.review:
Hexcells plus is a standalone game that's a follow on from the original hexcells. The concept of minesweeper/sudoku is still the core of the game and just like the first one the soundtrack is excellent.

The first hexcells managed to achieve a perfect difficulty curve where you never really got stuck for long periods of time which kept the game ticking over and enjoyable. Unfortunately, this one gets too difficult too quickly. There's barely any instruction as to the rules of the game and as this is a standalone from the first one, you shouldn't have had to play the first one to understand the rules.

By the time I got to the 2nd set of levels (2/6 through the game) I was already getting stuck for 5-10mins fairly often which just became boring and frustrating. It's not like other puzzle games where if you spend that long you might find a good chunk of the solution which makes the effort rewarding. You can literally spend minutes upon minutes staring to uncover a few more cells only to get stuck again because of how big some of the levels are. Maybe it's the way I play; I know there is always a logical way to move forward in the puzzle so I refuse to guess. But in no way does the game punish you if you do guess. You fail if you guess wrong too many times, but it should be like minesweeper where if you make a single wrong move you've failed the whole level. 

This is a hard game to give a thumbs up or down; it is very cheap so is worth getting. I think it would be a good idea to buy the other two hexcells and play them first. So then you become very familiar with the game and learn the strategies, then you can come to this one and enjoy it.

So, certainly don't buy this if it's going to be your first hexcells game. But also don't but it if you haven't play hexcells and hexcells infinite first. Otherwise, it is a good buy to complete the hexcells collection.

20669016.review: I honestly did not expect there to be another installment of Hexcells, but Hexcells Plus proved me wrong. The game not only tests you with standard deduction reasoning for marking and breaking hexes like in Minesweeper, but also makes you think even deeper about all the clues that are given. I literally spent about five minutes staring at my screen before going "Aha!" after a couple more moments of thinking. It feels very satisfying to break or mark a cell, knowing that you were able to figure everything out. Trust me, this game's a bit on the harder side, but the challenge is definitely enjoyable. If I had to think of a downside, I'd say that I was a bit disappointed that there was no save feature. As I said, the levels are hard and might take a while, so be sure to have lots of free time going into Hexcells Plus. Anyways, go give this a try if Hexcells left you begging for more or if you're just a fan of logic puzzles like minesweeper, sudoku, etc, just maaaybe wait for a sale to occur.

20652407.review:
This puzzle game is Minesweeper on steroids, and I strongly recommend it.

It is basically Minesweeper in an hexagonal grid, where mines have been replaced by blue tiles/hexes and uncovered numbers tells you how many of those blue tiles are adjacent to them. Correctly uncover all tiles to finish the puzzle. But various other visual clues have been added to the mix, such as: digits telling you the number of blue hexes in a row or column (or diagonal); numbered blue hexes indicating the amount of other blue tiles in its vicinity; question marks hiding information from you; and other intersting hint systems that let you deduce the locations of blue tiles without resorting to luck.

As far as I know, it is always possible to deduce the tile locations using the hints given. No more of these 50/50 chances that occur all to frequently at the end of a game of Minesweeper. And mistakes are allowed too, you can continue the puzzle even after clicking on a wrong tile. Though you need to keep mistakes at a minimum to unlock everything.

The presentation is clean, simple and slick. Cool visual aids are provided that help you easily identify all the tiles of a row, or all the hexes in a 2-tile radius around a numbered blue hex. These are particularly useful in big and unusually shaped puzzles (unlike Minesweeper, the shape of the grid varies from puzzle to puzzle).

The electro-ambient music is also very fitting for a game that requires your full concentration. Notes are played each time you click on a tile, merging beautifully with the ongoing music. It is a detail, but it certainly adds to the experience.

All in all, if you like this kind of puzzle game, you cannot pass this up.

20552276.review:
[h1]A Paladin’s Steam Review: Hexcells, Plus and Infinite. Cheesing in the Cells.[/h1]
[list]
[*]Genre: Minimalist Casual Atmospheric Number Puzzlers
[*]Developed & Published by: Matthew Brown
[*]Platform: Windows, Mac and Linux
[*]Business Model: Base Game
[*][i]Copy Purchased by Myself[/i] 
[/list]
[i][url=http://wp.me/p4fZDz-2Uz]Read the full & unabridged review about the entire Hexcells Series on A Paladin Without A Crusade[/url][/i]

[b]Overall Gameplay Thoughts[/b]
Hexcells is a minimalist puzzle game that I like to think of as a combination of Minesweeper and Sudoku. A comparison that has probably been made elsewhere. Every level is basically the same. You’re presented with a variable number of cells with a number in the top right corner telling you how many blue cells there are in the puzzle. The challenge is figuring out which cells are blue and which are numbers. If you guess incorrectly, it’s counted as a mistake that will affect how many points you get at the end of a level. The numbers on or adjacent to cells are telling you how many blue cells are connected to them. It’s up to the player to figure out the pattern by examining the numbers. In general terms, if there are two unknown cells connected to a cell that has the number “2” on it, they’re both blue cells. There are several different mechanics used to confuse the player and make them logic out the solution. Upon completing a level, you’ll be rewarded with points that are used to unlock additional groups of levels. As such, this does requires you to complete most of the puzzles with a minimal amount of mistakes in order to progress forward. 

[b]Hexcells: Plus Features[/b]
Plus is the expandalone title to the original featuring 36 new puzzles and a some new twists. The main new mechanics is a cell that tells you how many blue cells are in a radius around it. Otherwise, the game is as good as the rest and there are some tricky levels in it. It’s not required to be played but if you haven’t gotten enough Hexcells, this adds some more to theoretically sate that hunger. 

[b]My Main Issue With Hexcells[/b]
Here’s the problem I have with the entire Hexcells series. It’s a pretty good puzzle experience, if you play it how it’s intended to be played. However, I feel that they have a problematic design flaw: all of the puzzles can be cheesily completed. If you’re stuck at a certain sequence, you can just click through the rest of the puzzle making as many mistakes as you like. (I had some puzzles at 50-60 mistakes). What about the points you would get from a near perfect completion? Well, once you nearly finish the puzzle, take a screenshot and then instantly replay the level with your own personal guide. It’s possible to win all three games this way without much effort on your part. 

[b]PC Settings & Audio/Video[/b]
It’s a minimalist game so there really aren’t many settings to change. Since its running on the Unity engine, the Unity launcher menu pops up when you start the game every time. It allows you to change resolutions and turn fullscreen on/off. The graphics quality is set to beautiful and can’t be changed. However, I was able to play this on a basic, five year old laptop running Linux Mint and there was absolutely no trouble running it. Alternative keys can be changed here as well. Hexcells Infinite was the only game of the three that allows you to swap the left and right mouse button functions. 

[b]Final Thoughts[/b]
Overall, I think the Hexcells series is a decently executed puzzle idea with plenty of content. I take issue with the lack of anti-cheat but it's not enough to make it an anti-recommendation. (Thanks to a friend for making a case to change my mind on this). It’s a fun logic number puzzle series. And I did play the three games how it was intended too, with a few exceptions. I had quite a bit of fun deducing the my way through the levels and had several “aha!” moments despite it’s more casual nature. Additionally, it maintains a mellow and atmospheric experience that I can appreciate. While there is the less honorable part of myself thinking “you can just easily ‘cheat’ this game and not spend hours on it”, that doesn't disqualify it from being a decent puzzle game. So, if you can avoid cheating yourself, get the Hexcells series. But if you can’t restrain yourself from looking up help on even the slightest bit of challenge, I probably wouldn't get it. Otherwise, that's my thoughts on this series. 

[h1][url=http://wp.me/p4fZDz-2Uz]Read this review and more on A Paladin Without A Crusade[/url][/h1]

The more difficult levels can even take up to 30 minutes or so, which started to feel like too much, especially given that you cannot save the game in the middle of a level! Also, it does feel irritating if you make a mistake towards the end of a level after having spent 20 minutes on it, especially if you're after the Perfectionist achievement without cheating.

Anyway, the puzzles are hand-made and some actually almost made me laugh out loud when they revealed some perfectly composed, might I say beautiful, hint as to how the blue hexes are set. If you liked the original one, then this offers more of the same, but much more challenge too. (My play time ended up to 11.5 hours, but a couple of times I just left the game running while I was away from keyboard, so I'd say my actual play time is about 10 hours.)

20364816.review:
A logic puzzle that is like a combination of Minesweeper and Kakuro. Simple design & graphics, fitting music. You have numbered tiles that tell how many adjacent mines there are. And later on there are numbers outside the grid that tell how many mines are in that column. The Plus edition adds numbers inside mine tiles that tell how many mines are within two tiles. You use the information given to get through tiles and eventually uncover the whole area. There are no game overs (so you can continue on despite guessing or making mistakes) but you can do the puzzles without guesswork. However, this game is noticably more difficult and requires much deeper reading of possibilities than the original title.

The controls are pretty simple (left click to mark as a mine, right click to reveal). You can also right click on column numbers/mine numbers to hide them. It's not very obvious but you can access the menu/restart the stage by clicking on the word MENU on the top left corner.

I enjoy logic puzzles and these kept me entertained for a several hours (I spent a good amount of time just thinking about the problems and eventually got hints from people on the forums).

There is no save option (like in the original title). However, I found it a lot more annoying in this game because each puzzle requires a lot more time to solve. A physical sudoku or crossword puzzle on paper can be put away for later but this game clears all progress when you leave. I ended up taking screenshots of my progress so I could start from where I left off. [Edit: Hexcells Infinite allows you to save progress]

If there aren't saves because of save abuse (for perfect levels), then saves could be automatically deleted after they're loaded. And it seems like the devs could make it beyond the power of copy+paste if they really wanted to combat save abuse.

On a side note, misclicks sometimes ruin runs for a perfect score. I just repeated the puzzle but it could be nice to have an option that requires two clicks instead of one for those prone to misclicking.

A pretty big step up in difficulty from the original Hexcells, I think it has risen a few steps above casual and into the enthusiast level of difficulty. If you like logic puzzles like Sudoku/Kakuro you should try the original Hexcells first. If you enjoyed Hexcells and are looking for a new and harder challenge, this will probably be your cup of tea.

20243895.review:
Great sequel to an already great puzzler game. If you found the original Hexcells too hard, stop here because this sequel is a LOT more complex and harder. The original took me a little under 2 hours and wise nice and smooth to get into the system.
This however is in another league, it took me almost 12 hours to complete. Of course you can always guess your way through it, but there's no fun in that. The brilliance of this game lies in the fact that all puzzles can be solved by simply using logical thinking. There's never any guess work needed. On the downside, since there's so many variables to keep track of, it sometimes takes prolonged staring at the screen to figure out what move is next.
Which is also part of the greatness in the system. You sometimes have to hop from the left side to the right side of the puzzle or from bottom to top in order to make the next step. A nice change from doing things linear.

Also the game comes with a new smoothing soundtrack, a bit calm spacy tunes with no lyrics. Keeps you very focused (at least it did for me) but it can get a bit dull when you're stuck for a longer period.

All in all a worthy sequel, much much harder than the original but highly recommended if you're into logical problem solving or puzzles in general. If you dont want the spend too much get all three games in a package, or if you simple want to test out if this game is anything for you, start with the original.

20002233.review:
Однозначно рекомендую Hexcells Plus по 2-м причинам:

1). Если вы «одержимы жаждой» создания значков и собирательством игр в steam, что готовы кормить всю Valve Corp. То рано или поздно после создания значка, вам выдадут за ковку купон с весьма приличной скидкой (на выходе должно получиться около 10-20 р.) на данную игру – это первое;

2). Если вы хотите чтобы в вашем выдающемся профиле в витрине достижений в пункте «идеальные игры» красовалась еще одна дополнительная единичка, и вы поражали бы своих друзей своей принципиальной крутостью, то вы имеете 100% возможность этого достичь. В свете 1-ой причины 2-я является следствием первой - это второе.

Маленький бонус - за прохождение Hexcells Plus в виде достижений вам дадут цифры от 1 до 6-ти, которыми можно украсить свой профиль в витрине достижений! Что-нибудь написать вместе с буквами, как-нибудь «соригинальничать» ;)) это Trend в профилях Steam_а или попса – решать вам.

Если все вышеозначенное для вас важно, то эта игра вам необходима!!!

Теперь о самой игре. Сначала я подумал, что это обычный аналог «Сапера», но не тут-то было, игра шире и разнообразней. Только в ней уровни создаются не «рандомно»: они уже такие, какими их сделали разработчики, поэтому прохождение заключается в запоминании мест, где находятся «мины» что ли? что это непонятно. 

(При желании можно обратиться к Guide_ам по прохождению) 

Если все отмести, то игра расслабляет. После кликов мышью нужной кнопкой на «правильные» Hex_ы производится приятный звук, напоминающий звуки нот фортепиано или барабанов, так что получается подобие некой мелодии.

В заключение повторюсь: при важности для вас 2-х вышеозначенных причин я Hexcells Plus рекомендую!

19956818.review:
If you've played the original Hexcells, this version has harder puzzles, and is definitely a challenge for people familiar with this style of game. If you have not played the original Hexcells, I highly recommend buying that game first; the puzzles are more suited to people just starting this series.

I highly recommend this game, with a personal recommendation of buying the original game first. Even if you're adept at puzzles, it's a good refresher to do well in this version.

This is a copy+paste of my review from the original. Gameplay is the same, the puzzles are just harder:

-------

Hexcells plays like Minesweeper, using hexagons instead of squares. However, unlike Minesweeper which is randomly generated, each level in Hexcells is pre-made by the developer to have a unique and deducible solution. There are bits of spacial thinking that come in play, from crossword puzzles like Sudoku.

Hexcells also takes the minesweeper playstyle and increases the complexity (always offering a deducible solution though), by introducing row/column markings in lieu of additional viewable pieces, as well as special tile number markings that denote certain behavior of where the blue pieces will be.

I was a bit skeptical at first, but I'm really enjoying this series. I'm not noticing a terribly large complexity in this game, but I haven't gotten to the other two Hexcells games yet. I would recommend to people who enjoy puzzles.

19741811.review:
[h1][b]Game Series[/b][/h1]

Hexcells Plus is the second game of its' series. Previous game: Hexcells.

[h1][b]Game Visual/Audio[/b][/h1]

There isn't much can be said about the game's visuals asides from that they're minimalistic. Pretty much the same thing can be said about the game's audio. 

[h1][b]Gameplay[/b][/h1]

There is no difficulty mode option that's assigned. But each of the puzzles has their own difficult.

Hexcells Plus basically has same formula as its' predecessor Hexcells. So the objective remains the same. Which is to figure out which cells to make blue and which cells to make black.

There are total of three slots with six worlds that has thirty-six puzzles to solve. The first world for each of the three slots are automatically unlocked. Completing one world will unlocked the next one. All of these puzzles can be replayed after the first go around. Please do note that the puzzles in the other two slots are the same as the ones in the first slot.

There's no time limit in this game. Allowing the individual take as much time that they want to solve each of the puzzles.

There six achievements for this game. Each of these achievements has certain requirements before they can be unlocked.

[h1][b]Miscellaneous[/b][/h1]

Final thoughts, it's an neat game to play and enjoy. As for the game's replay value it's low. I would recommend this game but not at the full price.

19684541.review:
Eigentlich könnte ich an dieser Stelle genau dasselbe schreiben wie bei meinem Review zum Vorgänger Hexcells, denn im Endeffekt ist Hexcells Plus absolut identisch zu seinem Vorgänger.

Es gibt wieder 36 (natürlich andere) Puzzles, deren orange Felder in Minesweeper-Manier blau (linke Maustaste) bzw. schwarz (rechte Maustaste) markiert werden müssen. Um die richtige Auswahl zu treffen gibt es diverse Hilfsangaben, mit deren Hilfe man in einem logischen Ausschlussverfahren die Hexfelder entsprechend markiert.
Genau wie in Minesweeper gibt die Zahl in einem schwarzen Feld an, wieviele der maximal sechs angrenzenden Felder blau sind. Zusätzlich gibt es manchmal auch Angaben wieviele blaue Felder sich auf einer Linie befinden oder ob die blauen Felder zusammenhängend {x} oder verteilt -x- sind.

Zwei Neuerungen gibt es aber dann doch und diese betreffen die Lösungshilfen. So gibt es nun schwarze Felder, die nur ein ? enthalten, man also nicht weiß wieviele blaue Felder herum vorhanden sind. Damit man trotzdem nicht in Situationen gelangt, in denen nur noch raten weiterhelfen würde, gibt es als neue Hinweise blaue Felder mit einer Zahlenangabe. Diese Zahl gibt an, wieviele blaue Felder in einem Umkreis von 2 Hexfeldern vorhanden sind. Dieses neue Spielelement macht die späteren Puzzle durchaus anspruchsvoller, weil man stellenweise nur über die Kombination von mehreren Hinweisen auf die Lösung kommt.

Fazit:
Wer Hexcells gemocht hat bekommt mit Hexcells Plus fairen Puzzlenachschub in gewohnter Qualität. Und wer auch nur im Ansatz gerne Logicals in Zeitschriften löst bzw. gern mal eine Partie Minesweeper spielt, der kann auch hier bedenkenlos zugreifen, vor allem bei einem Preis von gerademal 3€. Und man muss auch nicht den Vorgänger gespielt haben, um die "Story" des Nachfolgers zu verstehen. ;)

If you liked the first one, this one is a no-brainer buy!

This is a good addition to the series, following up with all the clever things the first one was praised for and increasing the difficulty yet by having more complex puzzles. 

There's a bit of assumption that you're somewhat familiar with the mechanics, since the tutorial pretty much skims through the 'new' mechanics that were thoroughly tackled in the first one, but it's so that there are more levels that actually challenge you.

On that note, the puzzles start requiring more complex thinking than those in the first one, and you'd more easily get stumped here by overlooking minute details. Tricks such as how many are remaining and the overlapping ranges are slyly used to hide the correct path, and it was masterfully done.

And yes, there still is ALWAYS a proper solution; you never need to guess - much as you'd want to in your frustration.

Brilliant game. Will heavily recommend this, as with the first one.
